headline: Robinhood bets big on prediction market. Executive discusses.
summary: In August, Robinhood Markets (HOOD) expanded its prediction market to include event contracts on college and professional sports. Robinhood Vice President and General Manager of Futures and International JB Mackenzie discusses the investor hype around economic event contracts, which encompass the Federal Reserve's interest rate decisions, and other economic indicators. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Asking for a Trend.

headline: Morgan Stanley to offer crypto trading on E*Trade platform through Zerohash tie-up
summary: At launch, E*Trade clients will be able to trade bitcoin, the world's largest crypto token, as well as ether and solana, a spokesperson for Morgan Stanley said on Tuesday.  Once a niche asset class dismissed as speculative, cryptocurrencies have grown into a market worth trillions of dollars over the past decade, drawing in Wall Street banks, asset managers and retail investors alike.  The Trump administration's supportive stance on regulations has also helped crypto assets, with Wall Street brokerages now expanding their offerings in the space to tap into the lucrative business.

Once a niche asset class dismissed as speculative, cryptocurrencies have grown into a market worth trillions of dollars over the past decade, drawing in Wall Street banks, asset managers and retail investors alike.  The Trump administration's supportive stance on regulations has also helped crypto assets, with Wall Street brokerages now expanding their offerings in the space to tap into the lucrative business.

headline: Better Home stock skyrockets on praise from Opendoor bull
summary: Opendoor Technologies (OPEN) and Better Home & Finance (BETR) shares have seen colossal gains this past month after EMJ Capital founder and president Eric Jackson came out as bullish on the two digital real estate service companies. Eric Jackson described Opendoor as the Amazon (AMZN) of the housing market in an interview with Yahoo Finance. Robinhood Chief Investment Officer Stephanie Guild and Yahoo Finance senior reporter Ines Ferré discuss the value of the two companies in the real estate landscape and how investors should play the meme stock rallies being driven by social media engagement. Also catch Yahoo Finance's explanation of what exactly Opendoor does. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

headline: Shervin Pishevar Joins Nova Sky Stories Board of Directors
summary: BOULDER, Colo., September 23, 2025--Nova Sky Stories, the aerial entertainment company co-founded by Kimbal Musk, today announced that Shervin Pishevar, a mission-driven investor and entrepreneur and founder of Sofreh Capital, has joined the company’s board of directors. Sofreh Capital, co-founded by Pishevar, led the company’s recent $50 million Series B round.

Sofreh Capital, co-founded by Pishevar, led the company’s recent $50 million Series B round.

headline: Nvidia-OpenAI: What Wall Street thinks about the $100B AI deal
summary: Semiconductor giant Nvidia (NVDA) will be investing $100 billion in OpenAI (OPAI.PVT). This news comes just after Nvidia announced a $5 billion stake in Intel (INTC) alongside a new data center partnership. Robinhood Chief Investment Officer Stephanie Guild and Yahoo Finance senior reporter Brooke DiPalma gauge Wall Street's reaction to these Nvidia headlines and what it means for the chipmaker's valuation as it contributes to building out artificial intelligence infrastructure. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

headline: TradePMR, a Robinhood company, Launches 50 bps “Asset Match,” Bringing Retail-Style Incentives to RIAs

headline: TradePMR Offers 0.5% Asset Match on New Deposits for RIA Clients
summary: “It’s our way and Robinhood’s way of stepping into the RIA industry with a gigantic leap and saying, ‘We’re dedicated to the RIA space; we’re dedicated to independent entrepreneurs; and we want to make a mark, and we want to show advisors that we are pro-RIA,’” said TradePMR founder Robb Baldwin.
